title: For how long should a YouTube video be playing in order to be considered as one view? - Quora

response.answer_text: the second you watch a video, it is considered a view. however, if the video is 7 minutes and you watch 3 minutes of it, then as the channel my “"watch time” doesn't look so good. and a content creator’s watch time just shows how interested people are to a video. the leer it is, the worse it looks, the higher it is, the better it looks because it shows interest. if you're doing this for your own channel, you may not care because you're probably still small. someone with millions of subscribers WOULD care because i mean … that's their job. they gotta have analytics

The second you start watching it regardless of if it is your video and you are editing or it's someone else's on youtube or embedded in another website, it counts as a view. If you restart a video as well, ie hit refresh while watching a video, that counts as a separate or another view. Finally if you click a time stamp link in the notes or description field of a video TO fast forward you to particular point in the video, that also counts as a separate view! Cheers JoAnne Mbonigaba
As far as my experice, once video is started for playing by viewer it will concider as a view. No matter its 1 sec or 1min or 1hour!

According to Buffer 2017 report, it requires 30 seconds to count as a view. It’s less on other platforms (FB = 3 seconds): The Buffer Guide to Video Metrics: Everything You Need to Know About Social Video Metrics
